0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Meningococcal infectious disease; Prophylaxis: adults 56 years or older, not previously vaccinated, requiring a single vaccine dose: 0.5 mL SUBQ (guideline dose); 0.5 mL SUBQ as a single dose (manufacturer dose).

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Meningococcal infectious disease; Prophylaxis: (2 years or older) 0.5 mL SUBQ as a single dose (manufacturer dose); not routinely recommended for use in pediatric patients

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: allergic reactions, severe (eg, anaphylaxis), after a previous dose of meningococcal polysaccharide vaccine or any component of the vaccine

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• acute allergic reactions and anaphylaxis may occur; appropriate supportive medical treatment should be readily available during treatment
  • acute illness with or without fever, moderate or severe; defer vaccination unless the benefit of protection outweighs the risk of an adverse reaction
  • concomitant immunosuppressive therapy; may have diminished immune response
  • immunosuppression; may have diminished immune response
  • latex allergy; vial stopper of lyophilized vaccine and diluent contain dry natural latex rubber

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• WHO: Compatible with breastfeeding.
  • Micromedex: Infant risk is minimal.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Meningococcal polysaccharide vaccine is a combination of group-specific (A,C,Y,W-135) polysaccharide antigens derived from Neisseria meningitidis used to aid body immunization against meningococcal infection by inducing bactericidal antibodies specific towards these serogroups.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    for subQ use only; do not give IV or IM
  • Subcutaneous
    • withdraw supplied diluent (0.6 mL for single-dose presentation and 6 mL for multidose presentation) and inject into vial containing the lyophilized vaccine; swirl until thoroughly dissolved and vaccine is a clear, colorless liquid
    • do not combine through reconstitution or mix with any other vaccine
    • use single-dose immediately after reconstitution; multidose vials may be stored between 2 and 8 degrees C (35 and 46 degrees F) for up to 35 days after reconstitution
    • preferred site of administration is deltoid region
    • use separate sterile needle and syringe for each dose withdrawn from multidose vials

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono: This drug may cause shivering, headache, fever, or malaise.
